message.content: Geranium caespitosum is a herbaceous perennial plant that belongs to the family Geraniaceae. It is commonly found in dry, rocky habitats and alpine regions. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit and can reach up to 15 cm in height. The leaves of Geranium caespitosum are rounded, deeply lobed, and have a hairy texture. The flowers are small and bright pink, with five petals and ten stamens. The flowering period is typically from June to August. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal medicines to treat a variety of ailments. Overall, Geranium caespitosum is a visually striking plant that adds beauty to alpine regions and provides medicinal benefits to those who use it.
